concept.title: Materials Required to Clean Your Typewriter
concept.shortdesc: Multiple materials are required for the successful cleaning of your typewriter.

ul.li: A portable manual smith corona typewriter
Access to direct sunlight or a fan for drying purposes
Plastic sheeting or paper towels for work-surface protection
Compressed air with thin nozzle attachments. This can be an air can or machine air compressor
Soft-bristle brush. A car detailing brush or toothbrush can be used.
Multiple lint-free rags such as microfiber towels
Spray bottle with nozzle head or a dropper bottle

section.title: Cleaning Solutions

ul.li: Mineral spirits, gentle degreaser, or rubbing alcohol
Cleaning solution. Mild soap and water is ideal. All-purpose cleaners or detergents can also be used.

section.note: You can use hydrogen peroxide for stubborn stains or discoloration.

ul.li: Light-weight oil, such as sewing machine oil, gun oil, or specialized typewriter oil
